summary: This is a letter from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP attorney Peter M. Skinner to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding compliance with a grand jury subpoena. The letter transmits documents from the Giuffre v. Maxwell civil case and requests confidential treatment under various legal provisions.

persons.name: Peter M. Skinner
persons.role: Attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Author of the letter, representing Boies Schiller Flexner LLP in responding to a grand jury subpoena and requesting confidential treatment for the produced materials.

persons.name: Judge McMahon
persons.context: Signed the Sealed Order (19 Misc. 149) dated April 9, 2019, which appears to govern the production of materials in response to the subpoena.

connections.description: Skinner references and complies with a sealed order issued by Judge McMahon regarding the production of documents.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

events.title: Sealed Order Signed
events.description: Judge McMahon signed Sealed Order 19 Misc. 149, which governed the production of materials in response to the grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: A protective order was entered in the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell (15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)).

locations: United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP on February 5, 2019, as part of an investigation.
The firm produced a large volume of documents from the Giuffre v. Maxwell civil case, including depositions, exhibits, and productions from plaintiff, defendant, and non-parties.
The letter strongly requests confidential treatment for the produced materials under FOIA, Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), the Privacy Act, and other statutes.
The production includes specific document ranges such as 'MAR-A-LAGO 0001 - MAR-A-LAGO 0607' and 'VICTIMS_REFUSE_SILENCE_0001-0091'.
The firm states that submitting the materials does not waive attorney-client privilege, work product doctrine, or other applicable protections.
